org.hisp.dhis.commons.collection

Class PaginatedList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<T>
          • org.hisp.dhis.commons.collection.PaginatedList<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, List<T>, RandomAccess

    public class PaginatedList<T>
extends ArrayList<T>
    List implementation that provides a paged view.
    Author:
    Lars Helge Overland
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setPageSize

        public PaginatedList<T> setPageSize(int pageSize)
        Sets page size.
        Parameters:
        pageSize - the page size.
        Returns:
        this PaginatedList.

      • setNumberOfPages

        public PaginatedList<T> setNumberOfPages(int pages)
        Sets the number of pages. The page size will be calculated and set in order to provide the appropriate total number of pages. The resulting number of pages can be lower than the given argument but not higher.
        Parameters:
        pages - the number of pages.
        Returns:
        this PaginatedList

      • nextPage

        public List<T> nextPage()
        Returns the next page in the list. The page size is defined by the argument given in the constructor. If there is no more pages, null is returned. The returned page is not guaranteed to have the same size as the page size.
        Returns:
        the next page.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Sets the current page position to the first page.

      • pageCount

        public int pageCount()
        Returns the number of pages in the list.
        Returns:
        the number of pages.

      • getPages

        public List<List<T>> getPages()
        Returns a list of all pages.
        Returns:
        a List of all pages.
